Class WordTracker

java.lang.Object
appDomain.WordTracker
public class WordTracker extends Object
Manages a repository of Word objects stored inside a BSTree.

Responsibilities:

  • Load a previously serialized BST repository from repository.ser.
  • Read an input text file and add/update Word entries with occurrences (filename -> list of line numbers).
  • Persist the BST back to repository.ser.
  • Generate reports in three modes:
    • pf — prints words and filenames only
    • pl — prints words with filenames and line numbers
    • po — prints words with filenames, line numbers and frequency

The class uses Utils.check(String) to locate files robustly in common development/execution environments (working directory, res folder, or JAR directory).

  • Constructor Details

    • WordTracker

      public WordTracker()

  • Method Details

    • constructsFromFile

      public void constructsFromFile(String fileName)
      Reads fileName, tokenizes lines into words (stripping punctuation), and updates the BST with occurrences (per-filename line numbers).

      If fileName was previously processed, all prior occurrences for that filename are cleared first (so repeated runs update the repository, rather than duplicating entries).

      Parameters:
      fileName - path to the input text file to scan

    • loadTree

      public BSTree<Word> loadTree()
      Loads the repository tree from repository.ser if it exists.

      The method performs a couple of safety checks:

      • Verifies the deserialized object is a BSTree.
      • If the tree has elements, verifies the element type is Word.
      If the file is missing, corrupted, or types don't match, the method returns null and the tracker continues with an empty tree.

      Returns:
      the loaded BSTree or null if not loaded

    • saveTree

      public void saveTree()
      Serializes the current BST to repository.ser.

      Any IOException will be printed to standard error.

    • generateReport

      public void generateReport(String mode, PrintStream out)
      Generate a report of the repository using the given output stream.
      Parameters:
      mode - either "pf", "pl", or "po" (files only / files+lines / files+lines+frequency)
      out - the PrintStream to write the report to (e.g. System.out or a file stream)
